tittle: Do not care about employees health or wellbeing
author: Registered nurse
comment: I worked for this company in Ticonderoga NY for three months overnight and have to say this is the most abusive company towards its workers I have ever even heard of let alone had the displeasure of working for. This company literally wrote me up for being in the hospital. You read that correctly. I was sick and in the hospital with a chronic illness I revealed to them in the interview and they hired me fully aware of the severity of my illness which is severe. I was hospitalized with a bout and they wrote me up for "missing work during your three month probationary period." I had a second bout a few weeks later and was forced to come in at threat of my job. I could not function and it was a dangerous situation for me. They then threatened me with patient abandonment as I could not perform my duties and they got no one to take my place from their ultra skeleton crew that they had to staff it. They have so little staff they cannot handle any crises or emergencies. I was subsequently fired. The second bout nearly killed me. I almost passed away for real and it took me a month to recover and they terminated me for "too many absences in the probationary period." This company literally did not care that I almost died and they contributed to it. This is not exaggerated or overblown. It is a documented fact. They force all workers to make up every single day they miss during their own free time. They schedule you without asking or coordinating it with you. The level of disregard for my health and even my life was astounding and disturbing. DO NOT WORK FOR THIS COMPANY NO MATTER WHAT BONUSES OR ANYTHING THEY OFFER YOU. YOU WILL REGRET IT AND YOUR LIFE COULD BE IN JEOPARDY AS WELL AS YOUR CAREER. The experience has driven me from the nursing profession permanently. Nursing is not worth losing my life. - less BONUSES OR ANYTHING THEY OFFER YOU. YOU WILL REGRET IT AND YOUR LIFE COULD BE IN JEOPARDY AS WELL AS YOUR CAREER. The experience has driven me from the nursing profession permanently. Nursing is not worth losing my life.

author: CNA - Certified Nursing Assistant
comment: this place does everything so different and it's so cool. they actually care about the staff and patients. You have to wear a gate belt for YOUR safety. It's also right across from walmart, applebees, mcdonalds, subway, and dunkin.

author: Director of Dining Services
comment: The administration team are honest, communicative, and skilled. The opportunities are endless within the company. They are big picture leaders who pay attention to the little details that matter to the team members as well as the residents.

author: Resident Assistant
comment: Absolutely no support from supervisor, management is the main problem would never recommend working here, training also not good, really disappointed the management.

author: CNA - Certified Nursing Assistant
comment: this place does everything so different and it's so cool. they actually care about the staff and patients. You have to wear a gate belt for YOUR safety. It's also right across from walmart, applebees, mcdonalds, subway, and dunkin.

author: Director of Dining Services
comment: The administration team are honest, communicative, and skilled. The opportunities are endless within the company. They are big picture leaders who pay attention to the little details that matter to the team members as well as the residents.

author: Resident Assistant
comment: Absolutely no support from supervisor, management is the main problem would never recommend working here, training also not good, really disappointed the management.

tittle: This place needs a overhaul of management and give the workers reason to want to stay. Retraining of staff is definitely required.
author: CNA - Certified Nursing Assistant
comment:
What is the best part of working at the company?
The residents and getting to know them.

What is the most stressful part about working at the company?
Lack of staff, administration, compassion, unprofessional staff. Watching residents suffer do to neglect. That is why I quit.

What is the work environment and culture like at the company?
Unprofessionalism, workers are disgruntled because of lack of staff.

What is a typical day like for you at the company?
Very stressful, hard to get help or find help for that matter.

author: Receptionist
comment: Bosses are friendly. People are overall pretty great. Over time you get to meet more people then and then you really like the place. HR is questionable.

author: Rehab
comment: Under the guise of “doing whats best for the resident” are recommendations that ultimately maximize the facility’s profit. You’re overworked and always facing the dilemma of trying to maintain your ethics while trying to please the company so you don’t find yourself suddenly written up for menial issues. Pay is mediocre at best. Two stars is being generous, but there are many employees who care and do what’s right regardless. Too bad that sentiment doesn’t run all the way to the top.

tittle: not a fun place to work
author: Dining Director
comment:
What is the best part of working at the company?
sad place to work no sraffing no support

What is the most stressful part about working at the company?
no help no support liers no staffing

What is the work environment and culture like at the company?
it's like working in a slave farm

What is a typical day like for you at the company?
sad very sad long hours place is not clean

author: CNA - Certified Nursing Assistant
comment: When I started elderwood I was welcomed by all staff. They have all been helpful and showed me around the facility. Benefits are good. They try working with people on their hours. Met alot of great people since I started. The set up of the facility is amazing.

pros: ["Free programs, monthly staff appreciation activities, great pay, easy hiring process"]
author: Lpn
comment: This is the first company I have worked for that shows their appreciation to their staff with more than a pizza in the break room. They have so many benefits to working there as they want their staff happy.

author: RN
comment: No team work. People have their own peers and not good to the new hires. It kills your drive and passion. You have to learn things on your own if you work here.

author: CNA - Certified Nursing Assistant
comment: The residents are amazing and a pleasure to take care of! The women that work there are okay. Some cnas have been there for years and belittle new people and just overall make them feel bad about them selves the job alone can be hard you have to have the heart for it, and the sass from the coworkers are just a plus

cons: ["Short or lack of breaks, underpaid, undervalued, understaffed, cut throat staff and managers, condescending, liars and manipulative"]
author: CNA - Certified Nursing Assistant
comment: Sketchy higher ups. Money taken away from aids, no incentive to get shifts covered. Reward the ones that don’t work, while pushing the ones that do to pick up the slack of the others. Unfair, underpaid, understaffed ALL the time. Threatened to be sent home if you say that you’re understaffed, therefore leaving the unit MORE understaffed. Sinking ship and the only good is the residents.

tittle: The good about working here is helping children to be a better them.
author: Nurse Tech
comment: You are helping children to a better them everyday. You help them have someone who they can trust and be around. You are helping by keeping them safe and protected. The staff was very friendly and helpful.

author: Floor Technician
comment: Horrible management in every department. Managers there all play favorites and have their own inside circles. Also really bad pay for the work you do.

author: LPN (Licensed Practical Nurse)
comment: From the minute I walked through the doors, there was just that feel of " being home". The staff are very friendly and they do their jobs well and GO was very interesting.

author: RN Supervisor/admissions Nurse
comment: The DON calls staff to hours long meetings in his office to chastise for not accomplishing enough. Effectively forcing you to not accomplish your goals.

author: CNA - Certified Nursing Assistant
comment: Frequent workplace drama and constantly understaffed. The residents make it worth the hard work, but I constantly felt like I was being set up for failure due to the unsafe staffing ratios.

tittle: Great place to work. Very welcoming with flexible schedules.
author: Dining Services
comment: I have found Elderwood to be one of friendliest places I have worked. The company has a high level of professionalism and care for the residents and staff. The work/life balance alone is one of the top reasons to choose Elderwood.

tittle: Nurses are lax in supervising the lazy aides
author: Home Health Aide
comment:
Nice clean facility
Most aides do their jobs others slack and the nurses don’t say anything to them
Short staffed and always having to be mandated to stay another shift
Residents are wonderful!
The pay was fair and benefits were good.
I didn’t stay due to slackers and always having to do more work than just my assigned duties.

author: L p n
comment:
What is the best part of working at the company?
The residents. The pay now is decent. They really helped me work out a good schedule. Some 12 hour and some 8 hour shifts

What is the most stressful part about working at the company?
Nursing is stressful , short staffed and over worked staff

What is the work environment and culture like at the company?
Some what easy going once you establish credibility! Often they give too much leniency with no call no show

What is a typical day like for you at the company?
Med pass. Wound care. Documentation. Med pass. General care of residents. Passing meal trays. More documentation

author: CNA - Certified Nursing Assistant
comment: this place does everything so different and it's so cool. they actually care about the staff and patients. You have to wear a gate belt for YOUR safety. It's also right across from walmart, applebees, mcdonalds, subway, and dunkin.

tittle: Excellent opportunity and a great place to work
author: Assistant Director of Nursing
comment:
What is the best part of working at the company?
Well organized company with excellent upper administration who really care about employees

What is the most stressful part about working at the company?
Staffing and dealing with Covid

What is the work environment and culture like at the company?
Promote autonomy, encourage continuing education

What is a typical day like for you at the company?
Administrative duties, meetings, infection control compliance and meeting the needs of the residents

author: CNA - Certified Nursing Assistant
comment:
What is the best part of working at the company?
Staff and coworkers were great.. hr was a nightmare working with. Pay could've been better.

What is the most stressful part about working at the company?
Communication between the employee and employer

What is the work environment and culture like at the company?
Coworkers were great to work with but sometimes there was lack of motivation.

What is a typical day like for you at the company?
Some nights were go go to, others were laid back

author: CNA - Certified Nursing Assistant
comment:
Great place to work ! !
Plenty hours to pick up !
Space to grow as well ! I Love it

Plan to be an employee for a while !


Apply and join a great snap setting team !

author: Dietary Aide
comment: Be prepared to be harassed by employees who have been there for years … there’s no sense of direction everyone acts like they’re in high school . If you need to get off at a certain time just forget what your schedule says they’ll make you stay over 30mins - 1hr . The place is joke ! They haven’t been able to keep anybody new within a year .

author: CNA - Certified Nursing Assistant
state: Spent 14 years on staff as a cna.most of my coworkers were team players and good employees.Administration terrible,Trying to get time off was almost impossible,when I left there,I made several calls to HR,to get copies of medical documents copied,no response,very unprofessional.It was like if you left,you were terrible and you were black balled.I often worked alone on overnights with 35 residents to take care of,Management could care less,on evenings ,it was so busy I never got breaks,nor a lunch and so short staffed I was there at least 1 hour over EVERY night,finishing up documentation,as time would not allow otherwise.IT was exhausting,thankless,and sad to see the decline in care to residents,the things that were ignored and overlooked,With all the agency and burnt out underappreciated,overworked employees,I could no longer put my name to that and got the heck out of that awful place!!!!

cons: ["Consistent in ruining your clothes and over heating"]
author: Dietary Aide/Dishwasher
comment: Job wasn’t bad but the pay was bad causing me to look for a job that would pay better since I’m looking for a job to sufficiently pay for an apartment

author: Registered Nurse
comment: Lack of quality leadership, no teamwork, high turnover, inability to retain staff, lack of basic quality care, constant resident falls, unaddressed building integrity safety issues.

author: Unit Clerk
comment:
What is the best part of working at the company?
It's a very close knit facility in the heart of town. We are all like family


What is the most stressful part about working at the company?
Lack of staffing. Many employees are working several jobs to cover each department

What is the work environment and culture like at the company?
Administration treats its employees like one big family

author: Administrative Assistant
state: Great people to work with. Most of the time they listen to staff thoughts and ideas. They do offer good paid time off. Because they are so often short staffed, it makes it very difficult to stay focused on the task at hand, which can endanger the residents.

tittle: Co-workers are the best thing about this place. Sometimes.
author: CNA - Certified Nursing Assistant
comment: The management does not care about you here. They will push you to your physical and mental limits while not helping you as you struggle. We had to fight for over a year just to get our annual pay raise that was fair with current inflation.

author: Environmental Services
comment: everyone that works there is very helpful. I just recently started at the wheatfield location. i enjoy working there and getting to know the residents.

author: Dietary Server
comment: Belonging feeling part of the team. Work well with my schedule. Work with a team to achieve a common goalI know my back ground has prepared me for this role I look forward to becoming a valued contributor to the team.

author: CNA - Certified Nursing Assistant
comment: It was such a beautiful place to be when it was Called "BIRCHWOOD" the owner had a Huge heart and cared about his Staff. Had so many Perks until it was sold and things changed drastically.. Bottom line is that Management stopped caring and you became a number, and all perks were taken away...

pros: ["Free Uniforms which is really nice. The company is willing to work with you"]
cons: ["I do not have any at this time"]
tittle: The Good and Bad About what stands out for working for Elderwood
author: Support Aide
comment: Everyone seems really friendly. I'm very excited to start and have a floor I work regular with resident and co workers I get to know. I like that I had the options of what floors I'd be interested in working I got to pick to. I can't really think of anything bad the facility seemed clean and it didn't smeel.

author: Laundry Aide
comment:
What is the best part of working at the company?
I have worked at Elderwood for over 10 years. It's a wonderful place to work. The staff are some of the most amazing and caring individuals I have ever had the privilege of knowing. .

What is the most stressful part about working at the company?
Sometimes the communication isn't great

What is the work environment and culture like at the company?
Very good.. Pretty easy going

What is a typical day like for you at the company?
Busy but productive

author: RN Unit Manager
comment: The medical providers listen to the assessments, recommendations, and vocal needs of patients and form a plan with the help of the staff on unit in order to meet the patients healthcare needs. However, lack of true support from administration lacks, administration never followed through with assisting in staff needs, and staffing ratio was highly unsafe. Patients needs were neglected and many floor staff with very poor attitudes were left not corrected. Very toxic place to work and many hard working staff are wrongfully terminated while the staff causing the issues are allowed to continue on.

author: CNA - Certified Nursing Assistant
comment: this place does everything so different and it's so cool. they actually care about the staff and patients. You have to wear a gate belt for YOUR safety. It's also right across from walmart, applebees, mcdonalds, subway, and dunkin.

author: Front Desk Receptionist
comment: The only good thing. is the residents..Management horrible The ceo should really make surprised visits. They treat good employees bad seems like upper management only worries about small things nothing to do I guess

tittle: No room for moving forward and achieving goals
author: Certified Nursing Assistant/Scheduler
comment: Stuck in one position for over ten years with a bachelors degree and no help to move up in the company, used where they thought I was best to their own needs

author: CNA - Certified Nursing Assistant
comment: If you don’t mind being treated like trash for your efforts. The residents are always going to be the residents. Management.. admins.. they are against you and each other. The DON and the administrator hated each other. I heard the DON quit.

author: CNA - Certified Nursing Assistant/Caregiver
comment:
I was a nice place to work, I really enjoyed it
.Except for the few employees that have there little click. It was very good. I would recommend employment there.

pros: ["Affordable lunch, comfortable clean lunchroom, team building activities, easy access to practitioners"]
cons: ["None that are worth mentioning, health care comes with Cons of it self."]
author: RN Unit Manager
comment: I enter into a very clean, peaceful, welcoming environment daily. The culture of rendering quality care and creating a comfortable environment for our residents to live in is a constant throughout the facility. We work as a team and I love it.

tittle: Coming to work is very rewarding
author: Nursing Educator
comment: I work from7am-3pm M-F with on call responsibilities every 6th week. I enjoy my job and the people I work with. I feel that we provide excellent care to our residents.

author: Registered Nurse
state: I have been employed at Elderwood at Liverpool for 3 years now. One of the things about Elderwood that I love is the people I work with. It has made facing all the challenges times worth it because I know that we are in this together. I also love the fact that I have been able to learn so much. I was able to advance in my career and I know that my leadership is invested in my development and career advancement.

author: Director of Nursing
comment:
What is the best part of working at the company?
The best part of working for elderwood was leaving them

What is the most stressful part about working at the company?
It's disorganized and has weak leadership at the top

What is the work environment and culture like at the company?
Stressful

What is a typical day like for you at the company?
Stressfull, disorganized, and little organization

author: Chef
comment:
What is the best part of working at the company?
Light work load

What is the most stressful part about working at the company?
Budget cuts and uncaring administrators

What is the work environment and culture like at the company?
Terrible everyone feels screwed over only half are right. High turn over for a reason. Lot of one person doing everything so others can slack off

What is a typical day like for you at the company?
Come in serve lunch cook dinner serve dinner clean up go home

tittle: Very clean fun place to work
author: Director of Maintenance
comment: The building is beautiful. Staff is so nice and helpful. Management team is strong and very helpful.

author: Clerical
state: I have worked at this facility for 16 years and couldn’t ask for a better group of team members. There have been some very tough weeks, months throughout the pandemic and even though everyone was exhausted and burnt out, they showed up and worked together! The place is clean and inviting!

author: CNA - Certified Nursing Assistant
comment:
What is the best part of working at the company?
Coworkers

What is the most stressful part about working at the company?
Constantly being short staffed

What is the work environment and culture like at the company?
Very hectic and stressful

What is a typical day like for you at the company?
Never being able to give the care the residents need because you are assigned so many people to care for

tittle: More classes maybe have LPN training thru
author: TNA
comment: No issues straight forward no issues with tna classes! Teacher friendly and will to correct u if needed I like that! Other aids were friendly, cleanest nurse home I have ever seen smells better than most! Seems more of team setting than most nursing homes too

author: RN Staff Nurse
comment:
This is a safe, clean well organized rehab and skilled nursing facility. The staff is efficient with sufficient continuing education by management.
The building itself is well maintained with on-site repair and maintenance staff. All building codes with functional alarms are in place. Residents recieve polite and respectful care by the nursing staff. The hardest part of this job is keeping up with patient activities because many residents are living an active lifestyle. The most enjoyable part of any Healthcare position is providing the best of care.

author: Dining Supervisor
comment:
What is the best part of working at the company?
The residents

What is the most stressful part about working at the company?
Management sucks

What is the work environment and culture like at the company?
Dull, not fun, long dragged out hour

What is a typical day like for you at the company?
Boring tiring anger filledn

author: Support Aide
comment: Straight pointless. I love the residents, it’s the people with actual sense I can’t stand. And the authority is so rude. I get paid nothing. Ready to quit

tittle: Very clean, orderly and pleasant facility
author: CNA - Certified Nursing Assistant
comment: Very compassionate, caring and professional staff. Good interaction with residents. They seem to be happy and did not notice any negative behavior. Till now my observation is good

author: CNA - Certified Nursing Assistant
comment: Everyone is friendly and welcoming. I would definitely recommend this place of employment to others rather you coming as an uncertified CNA, a HhA , dietary, any position this would be the place.

cons: ["Short staff, high turn over rate with staffing"]
tittle: Management turn over rate is insane. The pay sucks!
author: Medication Technician/Resident Care Aide (current)
comment: Elderwood is not the best company to work for. The pay sucks and it is very unorganized. Management turn over rate sucks they have been through 3 Directors and 2 administrators and 3 Human Resource people! They stopped feeding the staff as well and they are always short staffed!

author: Dietary Aide
comment: No breaks, short staffed, no work life balance, very high school mentality, can’t have fun. Pressured to work over and pick up extra shift on days off.

author: CNA - Certified Nursing Assistant
comment: this place does everything so different and it's so cool. they actually care about the staff and patients. You have to wear a gate belt for YOUR safety. It's also right across from walmart, applebees, mcdonalds, subway, and dunkin.

tittle: Great work place and wonderful team
author: CNA - Certified Nursing Assistant
comment: It's hard to find a good team in the medical field, however at Elderwood not only do they work with you but they encourage you to go further in your career if that's what you want. Everyone is kind and ready to help!

tittle: So far staff are helpful and patient
author: Ra/ HHA
state: It’s only been a few days but things are going better then expected! Employees worked together great and help each other if we’re not sure what to do ! ! It is like one family working together to achieve are goals of making our residents enjoy their living at elderwood and remain independent as much as possible! If they need help we are there for their them! I truly enjoyed meeting the residents and looking forward to being part of their family!

cons: ["Management causes problems and interferes with workflow"]
tittle: Extremely high turnover lack of leader ship
author: LPN Team Leader
comment: When they did not have enough CNA‘s they got “creative “and would make LPN‘s (with a bad back or bad knees or for example a very elderly LPN woman near retirement) take a full CNA assignment.

tittle: Nursing staff is supportive and dedicated to their work
author: LPN Team Leader
comment: I work the night shift so it"s not as fast paced as at other shifts. I enjoy the last 2 hours of the day when I interact with the residents. Staff are very supportive of each other, especially during staffing shortages. Management is supportive of nurses. The facility is well equipped and staff have what they need to perform their jobs

tittle: Productive and secluded with a friendly atmosphere
author: Pharmacy Technician
comment: I have yet to begin my first day but my first visit to Elderwood's Plainville location was a pleasant one. The environment is relaxed yet productive. The tools and machines available at the location were impressive and well-maintained. I look forward to working there.

tittle: A culture of environment where it makes a place of Safety
author: Maintenance Supervisor
state: I enjoy coming in daily finding new difficult maintenance problems needed to fix and learn how to take care of as quick as possible. Just to help the Facility the best I can in the proper way done Right.

tittle: Staffing is short but team work is great
author: Dining Supervisor
comment:
I Love working here. Even though staff is short they work together and everyone is friendly. I honestly have more work life balance at this facility and felt more appreciated then my last facility. My last facility didn't care if you had work life balance and the facility didn't care about staff or residents they just cared about bottom line. This is truly a blessing to work at Elderwood.
Glad to be part of the team !

author: RN Staff Nurse
comment:
Originally had a great team to work with, 4 out of the 8 hrs I was on duty (due to 12 hr shifts/split); Until we all became burned out mentally & physically due to short staffing & poor management. If co-workers weren't quitting, they were getting terminated.
On a positive, they're pretty accommodative if u want to pick up hours (4,8,12,16).

author: CNA - Certified Nursing Assistant
comment: If you’re not in the office up front prepare to work to death. No one comes out to help. All they care about is a paycheck instead of the people who have to live there.

cons: ["Terrible benefits, takes your money, disgusting environment, awful administration"]
tittle: This is the shadiest place I’ve ever worked.
author: CNA - Certified Nursing Assistant
comment: Do not work for this company. I don’t how the other locations are but the one I work for is absolutely terrible. Management will have different rules for different people. They will take away your bonuses for the entire week if you call out. A coworker of mine had $600 in bonuses and had to call off for a family emergency and lost all of it. There bonuses are a joke too, $75 for a full shift, then they wonder why we’re so short staffed. And most of the time you’ll be walking into a complete mess. Some nights I’m by myself as an aide for 40 residents. They do not care about you and will replace you in a heartbeat. Everyone I know that was done dirty by this place and left is doing way better than they ever were with Elderwood.

author: Licensed Practical Nurse
comment: Constant change over in management. There is no career growth. The over all management for the entire assisted living will set people up and she changes orders to get people back into the facility that are not what the components for assisted living care. Poor care of residents due to lack of staff.

author: HHA/Med Tech
comment: If you’re able to multi task good, pretty calm environment to work for. Some days you’re on your feet all day, others you may not be. Overall I enjoyed working over a year with the company.

author: Nurse Technician
comment: I am excited about joining this team! I look forward to learning about and caring for the children. So far my preceptor is giving me a lot of useful information and she also goes in depth about the things I may have questions about.

tittle: Administration did not know what to do
author: DIRECTOR OF HOUSEKEEPING & LAUNDRY
comment: Administration was always for the employees never for the management also administration showed favoritism with certain workers. There was never no support poor leadership

pros: ["professional environment, good benefits, offers employee activities such as occasional free lunches and contests to win prizes"]
tittle: Residents and families get personal attention
author: Receptionist
comment: I am a part-time receptionist at Elderwood at Williamsville. I enjoy working there. It's a positive environment and people are helpful to each other. I enjoy greeting the visitors; I get to know many of them who come in every day. Management is involved with the day-to-day running of the facility. My supervisor is aware of what's going on and is very flexible with hours and PTO. What is unusual about Elderwood is that part-time employees are eligible for benefits! I recommend it as a good place to work.

author: LPN (Licensed Practical Nurse)
comment: typical day start off with complaints, what someone did not do, I learned to keep my mouth shut. Management did not care about the residents. the hardest part of the job was to ask someone to help a resident. The most enjoyable part of the job was talking to the resident

cons: ["Set uniform color. No freedom to wear what you like"]
tittle: Crew working there are very welcoming.
author: LPN (Licensed Practical Nurse)
comment: Nurses there are very friendly and liked having me there. My trainer was helpful and detailed in training. I was or am ready to do things on my own after only 4 days of training. Feel comfortable there and liking it there.

author: Environmental Services
comment: So far I learned that Elderwood is about building people up and helping each other reach their full potential.I haven't had any bad experience with the company.

author: CNA - Certified Nursing Assistant
comment: this place does everything so different and it's so cool. they actually care about the staff and patients. You have to wear a gate belt for YOUR safety. It's also right across from walmart, applebees, mcdonalds, subway, and dunkin.

author: Scheduler
comment:
Don’t trust anyone. Favoritism on every unit.
Plus side it is a very clean facility and the residents are wonderful.
They tell you what you wanna hear and do t always follow through.

author: Dietary Aide
comment: i wouldn’t work here if you have back problems i have scoliosis and i was standing so much that i was in a lot of pain and couldn’t move than also i got too hot and almost passed out

author: Dietary Aide
comment: I like working with others and helping elder people, I like to cook to or prepare for something. I respect everybody with nice manner, I like to work as a team

author: Manager
comment: Work life balance is difficult at times. Some days were long but paid time off was generous, but it is difficult time off approved and if approved, still be able to take it off. Opportunity for growth if you have the right people leading and wanting you to advance (instead of holding you back in fear of losing you)

author: LPN (Licensed Practical Nurse)
state: Nice building, Beautiful surroundings. Nice Residents. However, always short staffed. Wage increase recently should help. Good PTO benefits. Mostly pleasant co-workers. Good work environment.

author: Licensed Practical Nurse
comment: place is good compared to other similar places ive worked in. staffing is an issue like every where in health care but it is manageable. they are flexible and willing to work around ur schedule

tittle: The residents were wonderful to serve and interact with but the management was not
author: Dietary Aide/Server
comment: Overall a good starting job, but there was not much place to grow, not the best pay, and I was overworked almost every week. We were understaffed which lead to having to pick up so much overtime, I barely had free time to myself.

author: CNA - Certified Nursing Assistant
comment:
Not enough CNAs pet patient ratio. This is going to lead to neglect a back injury or even worse an injured pt.


The ratios are not in accordance with nys guidelines. . The ratios are way off.....just not safe.

author: Administrative Assistant
comment: Everyday is an opportunity to learn and grow. You get to meet a lot of nice people and management and staff are always there for you. Love working here!

tittle: Absolutely no support from supervisor, management is the main problem .I would never recommend working here
author: Resident Assistant
comment:
This is the only place that maintance tells you when your getting a new resident not nursing and it's 2 hrs before they arrive.
Maintance also orders and distribute nursing supplies lots more to be said but honestly you must experience it to get a true feel of disfunction junction .

author: Receptionist
comment: Compensation wasn’t the best part of working there but it was definitely the residents. You gain relationships with your residents and coworkers that are meaningful. I am very happy i worked here, it opened the door for new possibilities.

author: Maintenance Assistant
comment: The hiring process is long you have a lot of stuff you have to get done it’s like working in a family environment people and management are real nice

tittle: Please don't put your parents/family here
author: Environmental Services
comment:
I've only worked here for about 4 months and right now I can tell you to NOT bring you family here. We are so short staffed residents get IUDs due to lack of bathroom trips and rarely get the regular care and attention they need. I'm not even a nurse and I had to be the one to clip a residents unkempt nails because nobody else would. People are constantly waiting on showers, haircuts, and other hygienic maintaince due to the staffing issue. (Both bad employees and a lack of general staff) Residents also hardly get the memory care and physical therapy they need, and the food is no better than even the poorest school lunches. At $500+ day to live here, and getting more overcharged on top of that.
The current head nurse is a complete bully to their coworkers for no real reason and is soon to be put in a higher position than they are now.

Bad things aside, the job is not that hard. So long as you keep everything as tidy as you can, it's extremely easy just to do minor upkeep each day. If you like social interaction, the residents are very sweet and will be happy to carry on conversation while you work. Most residents may even be out of their rooms for the day and it makes it easier to get in and get the job done.

TLDR, very drama-filled and cliquey, but we are looking for people who are willing to do their job and do it well/correctly, for the betterment of quality of life for the seniors of our community.

author: TNA
comment: The interview process was great. The educator’s very helpful and, attentive. and they work with you. Very excited to start with the company and what it has to offer.

pros: ["You get to help take care of elderly"]
author: Support Aide
comment: I have had a great experience getting hired an everything has been great . I applied for the TNA and or support aid position and I can't wait to start my job and working with elderly is always a nice thing to do .

tittle: Amazing work place with such kind staff
author: Med Tech
comment: Elderwood is an amazing place to be. I just started there and I don’t even want to leave when my shift is over. The staff and residents are so sweet and kind. The directory wants what’s best for everyone and they always check up on you. Overall Elderwood is a great place to work!

tittle: Terrible Management and Terrible work environment
author: Activities Leader
comment: This place is terrible. Management is terrible, they never work with you on anything. They want you to go above and beyond but don’t compensate for it. Not a working environment that is anyone should be stressing over. The only pro about this job is putting a smile on the residents faces that’s all. Besides that this job and place is terrible.
